N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 476.2 - Terms and conditions

State Regulations
(a) An operating certificate shall state the
name of the facility, its location, the name and address of the authorized
agency, corporation, association, organization, proprietary operator or public
agency, who or which operates such facility, the type of facility, and the
maximum resident capacity. (b) Except for a facility operated by an authorized agency, as such term is defined
in section 371.10(a) of the Social Services Law, every operating certificate
must specify the duration of its period of validity, as may be determined by
the department. Such duration may be for a limited or a perpetual period of
time. (c) No facility subject to
the requirements of this Article shall be operated otherwise than in accordance
with the terms and conditions of its operating certificate. The operating
certificate of any facility may be revoked, suspended, or limited upon a
determination by the Office of Children and Family Services, after a hearing
and in accordance with procedures set forth in Part 434 of this Title, that the
operator has failed to comply with the requirements of Federal, State, local
laws or regulations applicable to the operation of such facility or provider
agency. (d) A facility shall not
discontinue operations in accordance with the terms and conditions of its
operating certificate except upon notice to OCFS at least 90 days in advance of
the proposed discontinuance. Such notice shall include the submission of a
plan, to be approved by OCFS, for the transfer of all residents therein to
other facilities or, where appropriate, to arrange for the return of such
residents to their families or to another planned living arrangement with a
permanency resource in the community. (e) In accordance with written instructions
from the department, an operating certificate shall be surrendered by the
facility to the department upon the discontinuance of operations, upon a change
in the nature of the facility, its operations or ownership, and upon the
revocation or suspension of such certificate. (f) An operating certificate shall be posted
conspicuously in the facility at its stated location. Notes
